front: What are the main /////TEST((((( types of roads in Spain?
back:
• Interurban roads (highways or 'carreteras')

• Urban roads

front: What are the three main types of interurban roads in Spain?
What is the minimum speed capability required for vehicles on autopistas and autovías?
Key features of autopistas (motorways) in Spain?
back:
• Separate carriageways
• Median strips
• No level crossings
• Limited access
• Usually tolled

front: Key features of autovías (dual carriageways) in Spain?
back:
• Separate carriageways
• Median strips
• Some level crossings possible
• Less restricted access
• Always free

front: What is a conventional highway in Spain?
back:
• Any other interurban road
• No special limitations
• Single or dual carriageways
• May have level crossings

front: Which vehicles/users are NOT allowed on autopistas and autovías?
back:
• Bicycles
• Mopeds
• Vehicles for people with reduced mobility
• Pedestrians
• Animals

front: Are motorcycles allowed on autopistas and autovías?
back: • Yes, motorcycles are allowed on autopistas and autovías

front: Can cyclists use the hard shoulder on autopistas and autovías?
back:
• Cyclists over 14 years old may use the hard shoulder
• Only when not prohibited by signage
• Only on certain sections where it's explicitly allowed

front: On dual carriageways (autopistas/autovías) with 2 lanes in each direction, where should cars and vehicles >3.5t drive?
back:
• In the right lane
• This applies both inside and outside urban areas

front: On dual carriageways (autopistas/autovías) with 3 lanes in each direction, where should cars and vehicles >3.5t drive?
back:
• In the right lane
• Central lane for overtaking or turning left
• Never in the left lane
• Applies both inside and outside urban areas

front: On conventional highways outside urban areas with more than one lane in the same direction, where should cars drive?
back:
• In the right lane
• Other lanes can be used when necessary

front: On conventional highways outside urban areas with 3+ lanes, where should lorries, minivans, and special vehicles >3.5t drive?
back:
• In the right lane
• Adjacent lane allowed exceptionally
• Never use remaining lanes
• Change lanes only when traffic requires
